= light =

field: integer '''.light''' (Read-only)

== Description ==

The '''light''' field returns the number of active light sources contained within a unit.

== Field Access ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Field !! Type !! Access !! Description
|-
| light || integer || Read-only || Number of active light sources in the unit
|}

== Availability ==
This field is available on the following unit types:
* UNIT_ST_PC (Player Character)
* UNIT_ST_NPC (Non-Player Character)
* UNIT_ST_OBJ (Object)
* UNIT_ST_ROOM (Room)

== Examples ==

 dilbegin example_light();
 var
    light_count : integer;
 
 code
 {
    light_count := self.light;
    exec("say This unit contains " + itoa(light_count) + " light sources.", self);
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==

* This field is read-only and cannot be modified directly
* Use the [[Manual:DIL_Manual/setbright|setbright]] procedure to change how much light a unit emits
* The '''islight''' function can be used to check if a unit is a light source
* Related fields include '''bright''' (how much the unit lights up) and '''illum''' (light from transparent containers)

== Error Handling ==

* Returns '''fail''' if the unitptr is null
* Returns '''fail''' if the unit is not applicable
